p: Vanillic acid (4-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoicacid) (Fig. 16), an intermediate in the production of vanillin from ferulic acid is the main flavor component of cured vanilla beans. Vanillic acid is found in the roots of Angelica sinensis, a plant used in traditional Chinese medicine, açaí oil, olive oil vinegar and wine [ 161, 162].
